monthly_revenue.note: Product ready but cannot sell until government safety registration complete

development_stage.current: Completing final safety tests with electrical engineer
development_stage.bloom_funding_use: Final refinements from prototype to market-ready product

manufacturing_evolution.final_product_method: Screws and brackets (modular, like washing machines/appliances)
manufacturing_evolution.mentor_support: Dr. Ahmad Ayash (Lebanese inventor in America) helped transition

team_composition.note: Wife is primary co-founder. Not 'just' business people - care about people and environment

bloom_well_being_focus.label: deeply_appreciative_transformative
evidence: Most programs don't have this human side - people are most important
Bloom taught: don't burn out the human. Deadlines matter but HOW the person feels matters more
Skills assessment + well-being focus was unique
This 'stole his heart' compared to other programs

generosity_culture_shift.label: internalized_became_part_of_identity
evidence: Selection process taught teams to support each other - 'became part of my personality'
If I help others, others will help me. Not competition, collaboration
This way of thinking travels with you in life - become generous person
Bilal: 'This seed stays in the company you're building'

physical_product_mentorship.label: well_supported_grateful
evidence: George Khoury (Bloom mentor) consulted on technical issues, has HVAC/boiler experience
Dr. Ahmad Ayash (80 years old, Lebanese inventor in America) helped with manufacturing transition
Constantin (finance training) taught: Even if you're financial expert, accountant will see if you're doing it right
Claude connected him to Mark Beyrouthy's Energy Innovation Lab (UNDP, up to $25K grants)

cooperative_revenue_share_idea.label: interested_enthusiastic
evidence: When Bilal described 50-company revenue share model: 'I love the idea'
Liked that 50 become like one - stronger together
Said 'If you do this, share it with me, we'll study it, I'll be interested'
Excited about mutual support model

community_mentorship_passion.label: deeply_committed_giving_back
evidence: Works with Injaz as entrepreneurship mentor
President of Youth & Local Development Committee in municipality
Created 'Breeh Entrepreneurs' WhatsApp group (~30 youth)
Helped village girl apply for grants, won competitions, got funding
Offers help 'without charge' - 'This is what I love to do'

explicit_needs.evidence: Electrical engineer doing final safety test. After that, register with government (Lebanon Ministry). Only then can legally sell product
Applied to Mark Beyrouthy's Energy Innovation Lab program with UNDP (up to $25K: $5K phase 1, $20K phase 2). Had interview recently. Bloom is ecosystem partner
Bilal suggested catalog of all Bloom products, alumni buy from each other with Bloom discount. Ehab said discount portion could go to Bloom as revenue share

implied_needs.inference: Product ready but hasn't sold yet. Needs early adopters who are eco-conscious and innovation-friendly. Bloom alumni are ideal first customers
implied_needs.evidence: Ehab said Bloom entrepreneurs are eco-conscious early adopters who care about his success

implied_needs.inference: Engineer/activist background, not marketer. Will need sales/marketing support once certification complete

implied_needs.evidence: Bilal suggested: reverse-engineer from available grants → ideation workshop → proposal writing. Ehab interested

core_values.evidence: Environmental activist since 2015 (waste crisis, landfill campaigns). 'We're not businessmen who only care about money. We care about money but we care about NOT hurting people or environment'

Loved Bloom's human-centered approach. 'People are most valuable. If people don't drive the startup, it won't move. Need balance.' Management + Claude + Bilal + David were all supportive, only saw kindness
Bloom's selection process taught mutual support - 'became part of my behavior, my personality.' Helps youth without charge. 'If someone needs help, I help them. No fee. This is the honor.'
President of Youth & Local Development Committee (municipality). Created Breeh Entrepreneurs group. Works with village to solve problems (waste sorting, treatment center). Injaz mentor
Participates in stand-up comedy open mics. Read 'Comedy DNA' book. Suggested 'pitch night with comedy' - reduce pressure, everyone pitches together with humor. 'Laughter is medicine'

interest_level.label: enthusiastic_aligned_values
evidence: Loved revenue share idea: 'I love the idea. 50 become like one, stronger together'
Said 'If you do this, share it with me, we'll study it, I'm so excited'
Already practices mutual support philosophy from Bloom
Community organizer mindset - understands collective strength
interest_level.note: May need revenue first before contributing percentage, but philosophically very aligned

co_design_contributions.description: Combine startup pitches with stand-up comedy format. Everyone pitches (3 min), but makes it funny/light. 'Reduces pressure - not alone, we're all together'
co_design_contributions.reasoning: Laughter as medicine. If can make sad person laugh, pull them out of sadness. Comedy that doesn't hurt anyone - we all laugh together

co_design_contributions.description: Bilal's idea that Ehab loved: Find available grants → run ideation workshops for problems those grants address → teach proposal writing → submit together
co_design_contributions.reasoning: Connects funding opportunities with problem-solving. 'Why focus on environmental activism? Because there's funding for it. Let's do ideation for those problems'

co_design_contributions.description: Ehab suggested: Bloom discount for alumni could also generate revenue for Bloom. Customer gets discount, seller gets sale, Bloom gets small percentage
co_design_contributions.reasoning: Win-win-win model. Alumni support each other + Bloom gets sustainable funding

co_design_contributions.description: Breeh Entrepreneurs WhatsApp group (30 youth), workshop at municipality, connected youth to grants (girl won competitions + got IdeaLab funding, another applied to Rural Entrepreneurs)
co_design_contributions.reasoning: Local community activation model that could be replicated across Bloom villages

most_valuable: Generosity culture in selection process (teams support each other)
Diverse training (finance, marketing, technical - got out of our 'box')
Claude's connection to Energy Innovation Lab
what_worked: Constantin's finance training: 'Even if you're financial expert, let accountant review - they'll see if you're doing it right'
Mentor accessibility (George always available for consultation)
design_suggestions: More physical product manufacturing mentors (Dr. Ayash was external, not Bloom)
Bloom product catalog with alumni discounts
Online + in-person hybrid (breakout rooms on Zoom)

readiness_assessment.reasoning: Exceptional values alignment (environment, generosity, community). Active community leader and mentor. Product almost market-ready. BUT: Pre-revenue (awaiting safety certification). Risk: First physical product launch, unproven market demand. Strength: Deep Bloom values integration, Energy Innovation Lab grant pending ($25K potential), strong local community support, environmental mission clarity.

recommendation.condition: Once safety certification complete and first sales happen, strong candidate. Energy Innovation Lab grant would accelerate readiness
support_needed: Marketing/sales strategy for physical product launch
Early adopter customer connections (Bloom alumni ideal)
Energy Innovation Lab grant application support
recommendation.unique_value: CleanTech energy efficiency, environmental activism, community organizer (Breeh Entrepreneurs), comedy/joy advocate, physical product expertise, South Lebanon rural representation, active mentor (Injaz), generosity culture exemplar
recommendation.special_note: Ehab embodies Bloom's values transformation. Generosity 'became part of his personality.' Perfect ambassador for cooperative mutual support culture. Also: only stand-up comedian in cohort - could bring joy/resilience programming.

energy_innovation_lab_grant.description: Mark Beyrouthy's Energy Innovation Lab with UNDP. Grants up to $25K ($5K phase 1, $20K phase 2). Bloom is ecosystem partner. Ehab applied and had interview

specifics.ehab_fit: Ecobath is energy-efficient water heater - perfect match
specifics.bloom_connection: Claude (Bloom mentor) made introduction day after Demo Day
specifics.status: Application submitted, interview complete, awaiting decision

energy_innovation_lab_grant.action_required: Bilal follows up with Mark Beyrouthy to support Ehab's application

dr_ayash_manufacturing_mentorship.description: Dr. Ahmad Ayash (75-80 years old, Lebanese inventor in America) mentoring Ehab on manufacturing transition from prototype to final product

specifics.dr_ayash_expertise: Inventor with patents, HVAC/oven manufacturing, ayash.com website
specifics.connection_origin: Ehab knew him from 2015 environmental activism (waste crisis), stayed in touch
specifics.value: Helped transition from welded prototype to modular product (screws/brackets like appliances)

dr_ayash_manufacturing_mentorship.bloom_learning: Bloom could benefit from connecting other physical product entrepreneurs to Dr. Ayash

breeh_entrepreneurs_model_replication.description: Ehab's 'Breeh Entrepreneurs' WhatsApp group model (30 youth) could be replicated across other Bloom alumni villages

what_ehab_did: Created WhatsApp group for village youth interested in entrepreneurship
Ran workshop at municipality (as Youth Committee President)
Result: Girl won competitions + got IdeaLab funding, another applied to Rural Entrepreneurs
specifics.replication_potential: Other Bloom alumni in villages could activate local youth using same model
specifics.support_needed: Ehab as facilitator/trainer for other village leaders

breeh_entrepreneurs_model_replication.action_required: Map Bloom alumni in villages/towns, connect them with Ehab for community activation training

pitch_night_with_comedy.description: Ehab's idea: Combine pitch night with stand-up comedy. Everyone pitches their startup in funny way (3 min). 'Reduces pressure - not alone, all together'

specifics.ehab_background: Does open mic stand-up comedy, read 'Comedy DNA' book, participated in online comedy challenges
specifics.format: Write serious pitch first, then find where jokes fit naturally (not forced)
specifics.benefit: Laughter as medicine. Pitch in context of fun, not solo pressure. 'If I can make sad person laugh, pulled them out of sadness'
specifics.bilal_addition: Bell curve - some will be funny. Let's find them and see who shows up

pitch_night_with_comedy.action_required: Pilot comedy pitch night with small group first, Ehab facilitates

bloom_product_catalog_revenue_model.description: Catalog of all Bloom products/services. Alumni buy from each other with Bloom discount. Portion goes to Bloom as sustainable revenue

specifics.seller_benefit: Early adopters who care about their success
specifics.ehab_addition: Discount portion could be Bloom's share - win-win-win

bloom_product_catalog_revenue_model.action_required: Design catalog platform, pricing/discount structure, revenue share terms

grant_reverse_engineering_workshops.description: Bilal's idea that Ehab loved: Find available grants → run ideation for those problem areas → teach proposal writing → submit together

specifics.workflow: Grant search → Ideation workshop for problems grants address → Proposal writing workshop → Submit
specifics.ehab_reasoning: 'Why environmental activism? Because there's funding for it. Connect funding with problems we care about'
specifics.ehab_expertise: Worked with Mercy Corps 2+ years (field coordinator), experience with NGOs and donors

grant_reverse_engineering_workshops.action_required: Ehab co-facilitates with Bilal: grant search + ideation + proposal writing series

key_quotes.on_bloom_values: We're not businessmen who only care about money. We need money, yes, for the project. But if money was our priority, we'd be somewhere else. We care about people, not hurting anyone, living in parallel - the human side and the material side. Bloom got this.
key_quotes.on_generosity_culture: This became part of my behavior, my personality. This thing Bloom did - teaching us to support each other in selection - I've never experienced this anywhere. It becomes part of who you are and travels with you in life. You become a generous person.
key_quotes.on_bloom_human_centeredness: Bloom stole my heart with this thing. Skills are important, but taking care of ourselves as PEOPLE - I participated in other programs, they don't think about this human side. People are most valuable. If people don't drive the startup, it won't move. There needs to be balance.
key_quotes.on_cooperative_idea: I love the idea. 50 become like one - stronger together. If you do this, share it with me. We'll study it. I'm so excited.
key_quotes.on_community_mentorship: This matters to me so much - as many youth as possible experiencing what I experienced with Bloom. It's different. If someone asks me which program, I say Bloom. If someone wants to live this experience, I know which one to recommend.
key_quotes.on_laughter: Laughter is medicine. If you can make someone who's sad laugh, you pulled them out of the sadness they might have been in for days. Laughter that doesn't hurt anyone - we all laugh together.
key_quotes.on_helping_without_charge: Any help I can give you is an honor for me. I'm ready, without any charge. This is what I love to do.
key_quotes.on_bloom_team: We only saw kindness from all of you - management, Claude, you (Bilal), David. You're supportive and good. We didn't see ugly sides. This is who you are, your nature.
key_quotes.on_environmental_mission: I'm an environmental activist. I work on this from my heart and conscience - for the environment and for people. This matters to me.
key_quotes.on_bloom_impact: If I died right now, I'd be satisfied - I did what matters. Not for anything except - you all (Bloom team), I love you all very much. This is priceless for me.

strengths: Deep Bloom values integration (generosity became identity)
Community leadership (Youth Committee President, Breeh Entrepreneurs)
Active mentor (Injaz, village youth, grant support)
Mercy Corps NGO experience (donor relations, field coordination)
Technical mentorship utilization (George Khoury, Dr. Ayash)
meta_insights.unique_contribution: Only entrepreneur who embodies ALL of Bloom's values transformation so visibly. Generosity, environmental mission, community building, joy/laughter, active mentorship. Perfect cooperative culture ambassador. Also: CleanTech energy efficiency, South Lebanon rural representation, stand-up comedy resilience programming, physical product expertise, NGO/donor experience.
